result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karvon W Matthews

records.addlTxt:
COURT LOWERED CASH BAIL TO $50,000.00.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Karvon W Matthews appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Karvon W Matthews.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court LOWERED Cash Bail. 

Scheduling Conference proceeded. Defense received discovery material; however, has NOT received an offer from the State. Parties are negotiating. Defense requested a plea date. Court granted request. Case adjourned for Plea hearing, Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defense Notice and Motion for Reduction of Bail; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

BAIL HEARING scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 8:30am via Zoom Video Conference.
Information provided to Victim Witness Advocate.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Karvon W. Matthews - #2022007426, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Karvon W. Matthews - #2022007426, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Karvon W Matthews appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Karvon W Matthews.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #18CF5622.. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective E. Fitting. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Karvon W. Matthews - #2022007426, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Karvon W Matthews in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Karvon W Matthews in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Karvon W Matthews appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness not present. Jail unable to accommodate a breakout room prior to the case being called. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-received and filed.
Attorney Annamarie Wineke.

Defendant Karvon W Matthews in Court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant Karvon W Matthews in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Reed advised the Court that Attorney Annamarie Wineke will be appointed to represent Mr. Matthews. Defendant requested to address bail. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Karvon W Matthews not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointd counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-LEE hearing in the trial court. Date provided by Br. 46 clerk.  Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Defendant Karvon W Matthews not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State request the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Karvon W Matthews not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Antonio D., Michael H., Angel J., Morgan Jackson (C0-DEFENDANT) and Timothy H.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Karvon W Matthews in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Karvon W Matthews in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
